description: This table stores general information about the stage of a patient's cancer, including clinical and pathologic staging attributes that were determined using methods defined by the American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC).

columns.name: STAGE_ID
columns.description: The cancer stage ID.

columns.name: STAGE_TITLE_NM
columns.description: The title of this cancer stage row, usually indicative of the body site or cancer type being staged.

columns.name: STAGE_TYPE_C_NAME
columns.description:
The type of stage in this record:  Free Text, AJCC, SEER, or Pediatric.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Free Text


AJCC


SEER


Pediatrics

columns.name: STAGE_CLASS_C_NAME
columns.description:
The classification of the stage in this row, for example Clinical or Pathologic.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Unspecified


Clinical


Surgical


Pathologic


Both Clinical and Pathologic


Retreatment


Autopsy

columns.name: STAGE
columns.description: The free text stage in this row.

columns.name: STG_PAT_ID
columns.description: The ID of the patient to which the stage in this row applies.

columns.name: STG_BODY_SITE_C_NAME
columns.description:
The body site to which the stage in this row applies.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: AJCC_LV_INV_C_NAME
columns.description:
The lymphatic vessel invasion of the AJCC stage.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


L0 - No lymphatic vessel invasion


L1 - Lymphatic vessel invasion


Not applicable


LX - Cannot be assessed


Lymph-Vascular Invasion Not Present (absent)/Not Identified


Lymph-Vascular Invasion Present/Identified


Unknown/Indeterminate

columns.name: AJCC_VENOUS_INV_C_NAME
columns.description:
The venous invasion of the AJCC stage.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


V0 - No venous invasion


V1 - Microscopic venous invasion


V2 - Macroscopic venous invasion


VX - Cannot be assessed

columns.name: AJCC_RESIDUAL_C_NAME
columns.description:
The residual tumor of the AJCC stage.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


R0 - None


R1 - Microscopic


R2 - Macroscopic


RX - Cannot be assessed

columns.name: AJCC_HIST_GRADE_C_NAME
columns.description:
The histologic grade of the AJCC stage.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


G0


G1


G2


G3


G4


T-cell


B-cell


Null Cell


NK (natural killer) cell


G1-G2


G2-G3


G3a


G3b


G3-G4


Gleason <= 6


Gleason 7


Gleason 8-10


Gleason X


Low grade


High grade


GB


GX


No grade assigned


Not applicable

columns.description:
The distant metastasis component of the pathologic stage.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: AJCC_M_C_NAME

columns.name: AJCC_CLIN_M_C_NAME
columns.description:
The distant metastasis component of the clinical stage.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: AJCC_M_C_NAME

columns.name: CLIN_STAGE_STS_C_NAME
columns.description:
The clinical stage status, such as New, Assigned, or Started.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


New


Assigned


Started


Complete


Reopened


Redone

columns.name: CLIN_SIGN_USR_ID
columns.description: The user ID of the last person to sign the clinical stage in this row.

columns.name: CLIN_SIGN_INST
columns.description: The date/time in external format of the last time the clinical stage in this row was signed.

columns.name: PATH_STAGE_STS_C_NAME
columns.description:
The pathologic stage status.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: CLIN_STAGE_STS_C_NAME

columns.name: PATH_SIGN_USR_ID
columns.description: The user ID of the last person to sign the pathologic stage in this row.

columns.name: PATH_SIGN_INST
columns.description: The date/time in external format of the last time the pathologic stage in this row was signed.

columns.name: UNK_PRIM_SITE_YN
columns.description:
Yes/no flag as to whether the primary tumor site or cancer type listed in the Body Site (I STG 65, STG_BODY_SITE_C) is merely suspected instead of being known for certain.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


No


Yes

columns.name: HAS_CS_INFO_YN
columns.description:
Yes/no flag as to whether this STG row contains any collaborative staging (CS) information.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: UNK_PRIM_SITE_YN

columns.name: STAGE_METHOD_VERS_C_NAME
columns.description:
Specifies the staging methodology (or version of that methodology) that is used to stage this cancer, from the Staging Method or Version (I FCS 60) of the corresponding Cancer Staging Definitions (FCS) record.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


AJCC 6th Edition


AJCC 7th Edition


AJCC 8th Edition


AJCC Version 9


Pediatric

columns.name: STAGE_CONV_SRC_ID
columns.description: For each new stage (STG) record created by the Epic 2014 cancer staging conversion, this item will store the ID of the stage record that it was created from.

columns.name: RECORD_STATUS_C_NAME
columns.description:
The record status category number for the stage (e.g. soft-deleted).


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Soft Deleted


Hidden


Hidden and Soft Deleted

columns.name: LINKED_PROBLEM_LIST_ID
columns.description: Virtual item that holds the problem list record ID (LPL) the stage belongs to.

columns.name: IS_STAGE_DELETED_YN
columns.description:
Virtual item that checks the latest contact of the Data Model Version (I STG 64) and Status (I STG 620) to determine if the stage record is deleted or not.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: UNK_PRIM_SITE_YN
